Potassium (K)

Description

Discovered in 1807, potassium is alike to sodium in terms of how quickly it dissolves when exposed to air. It is also similar to other metals such as lithium and sodium in terms of its appearance, with a silver inner state. It is also contained in certain foods & fruits, such as bananas and nuts.

Atomic Diagram

Atomic Number

19

Atomic Mass

39.098

Melting point

63.5℃

Boiling Point

759℃

Group

1

Period

4
